intro: Pentaschistis segetalis, commonly known as the field pentaschistis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as fields and roadsides. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often releasing a distinctive scent when crushed. It is native to parts of Europe and Asia and is often found in temperate regions.
